text: Hold the device up to the surface prepared for screw fastening.
Hold the device firmly.
Remove the push-in lugs from the device.
Place the back of the device onto the upper edge of the standard mounting rail.
Pull the lower half of the device away from the standard mounting rail.
Place the back of the device connector on the upper edge of the standard mounting rail.
Push the device connectors together until they engage.
Pull the lower half of the device away from the device connector.
Hang the back of the device connector onto the upper edge of the standard mounting rail.
Hold the device connector against the level surface prepared for screw fastening.
Pull the device away from the device connector.
Release the screws.
Remove the cover.
Note the clearances required for the 90 mm devices.
Seal the cover to secure it against unauthorized removal.
Hold the cable in the screw-type terminal.
Tighten the screw with a torque of 0.6 … 0.8 Nm.
Pull on the cable to ensure it is screwed tight.
Remove the cable from the unscrewed screw terminal.
Pull on the cable to ensure it is tight.
Disconnect the spring-loaded (push-in) terminal • Screwdriver DIN 5264 of the size 0.5 x 3 mm
Remove the cable from the oval opening.
Remove the screwdriver.
Pull the terminals out to the front.
Remove the cable from the unscrewed screw-type terminal.
Push-in terminals Disconnecting the conductor
Tighten the screw of the terminal in which the cable is inserted.
Hold the cable in the spring-loaded terminal.
Check that the clip of the removable terminals closes flush with the front panel.
Disconnecting the spring-loaded terminal 3 mm ~10°
Deinstall the defective device.
Connect the defective device at the terminals
Connect the power supply.
Confirm the new configuration by operating the SET/RESET push button for more than 1s.
Enter the article number of the desired device in the "Products" field.
Click the "Technical specifications" link in the result.
Click the "CAx data" link in the result.
To connect the Ethernet cable by passing it through the hole at the base of the Control Box, and plugging it into the Ethernet port on the underside of the bracket.
Replace the cap at the base of the Control Box with an appropriate cable gland to connect the cable to the Ethernet port.
Power down the control box and disconnect the main power cable from the power source.
Remove and discard the two cableties used for mounting the Teach Pendant cables.
Pressinthe clips on both sides of the Teach Pendant plug as illustrated, and pull down to disconnect from the Teach Pendant port.
Fully open/loosen the plastic grommet at the bottom of the control box and remove the Teach Pendant plug and cable.
Place the Teach Pendant plug and cable in through the bottom of the control box and fully close/tighten the plastic grommet.
Push the Teach Pendant plug into the Teach Pendant port to connect.
Use two new cableties to mount the Teach Pendant cables.
Connect the main power cable to the power source and power on the control box.
Connect your drive power indicator to the Digital Outputs as shown in the image below.
Verify the drive power indicator is correctly connected.
You can power on the robot arm and verify the light turns on.
In the PolyScope Header, tap Installation.
In the Side Menu on the left, tap General and select I/O Setup.
Under Output, select one of the digital_out outputs.
Tap the Action in program dropdown.
Select High when drive power is on, otherwise Low.
In the Header, tap Installation.
In the list on the left, tap General.
Tap Tool IO and select Dual Pin Power.
Connect the wires Power (gray) to TO0 (blue) and Ground (red) to TO1 (pink).
On the Teach Pendant, press the emergency stop button.
On the Teach Pendant, press the power button and allow the system to start, displaying text on the PolyScope.
A popup appears on the touch screen indicating that the system is ready and that the robot must be initialized.
Unlock the emergency stop button to change the robot state from Emergency Stopped to Power off.
Step outside the reach (workspace) of the robot.
On the Initialize Robot screen, tap the ON button and allow the robot state to change to Idle.
In the Payload field, in Active Payload, verify the payload mass.
Tap the Start button, for the robot to release its brake system.
In your Poly Scope header right corner, press the Hamburger menu and select Settings.
On the left of the screen, in the blue menu, press Password and select Safety.
Now, in Confirm new password, type the same password and press Apply.
In the bottom left of the blue menu, press Exit to return to previous screen.
